name: chokecherry
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
a type of North American cherry (= a small fruit with a single large seed in the middle, that grows on a tree) with a sour taste, that can be eaten when cooked: In his garden he grew chokecherries, gooseberries and currants. chokecherry trees chokecherry jam
Akchamczuk/iStock/Getty Images Plus/GettyImages
More examplesFewer examplesShe knows where to gather wild asparagus in the spring, chanterelles in the summer and chokecherries in the fall. There were raspberries along the way, or chokecherries, depending on the time of year.While sitting in a grove of chokecherry and dogwood trees, they saw a bear.She is cooking a pot of chokecherry jelly.
